args: Hmm. I guess this part is next?\nNay, but if I be doin' that...
Aaah! Oh, lass! Ye scared me!
Sorry, but I've been trying to get your\nattention for the last five minutes.\nYour concentration is impressive!
Anyway, do you know where the workshop\nmaster is? I'm supposed to deliver this.
I'm sorry, lass, but he went and got\nhimself captured by the Empire.
...So that's why I'm makin' this machine\nin order to go'n save him.
In that case, you must let me help!
Look, that's your prototype, right?\nLet me examine it.
Oh man, this is a MESS! I bet you've\nnever tried to build something like this\nbefore, have you?

Look, you can't just throw a bunch of
existing parts into a complicated machine
like this and hope it works out. You have to
modify and tune them appropriately!
So that was the problem...\nAye, it's true! I've no idea what I'm doin'!
Leave it to me! I'll make a blueprint with\neverything clearly labeled. Just modify the\nparts like it says and you'll be fine!
Don't get too excited. Even with a\nblueprint, the modifications will be\na challenge.
This job will demand utter precision.\nEven the tiniest mistake will result\nin the entire machine collapsing.
Aye, she's gonna be a rough one,\nespecially with time so short.
It's really a job for a team, but I guess\nyou and I will just have to make do.
Oh, I can get ye a team.
Ramona and the other lasses\nwould be perfect for this job.
I don't know who that is, but great!\nBring the whole gang along!
Aye, but I do so hate askin'\nothers for help...
This is not the time to be like that.\nIf you can get help, then get it!
Okay, lass, okay! No need\nto go twistin' me arm so.
So this is rokkan machinery, huh?\nWell, you can leave it to us!
Hee hee! I'll start with this one and—
I suppose I can work on this part here—
Nay, I'll do that one as well.
WHAT IS YOUR DEAL, LAZRY?!\nWHY ARE WE EVEN HERE?!
Seriously, Lazry, what's goin' on?\nYou asked for our help, but now you\nseem all put out that we're here.
Aye, sorry, lasses. It's just... Well, I'm not\nmuch when it comes to acceptin' help.
Ye can't be the world's greatest smith\nwithout carryin' your own water.
Me granda taught me that, so he did.
Wait, so THAT'S why you always work\nalone? It's some old family tradition?
But listen, Lazry—there's more than one\npath to being the world's greatest smith.
Yep! Our father was a great smith in his\nown right, and he gave us a different way.
He certainly did. His motto was\n＂Many hands make light work.＂
But proof is always better than debate,\nso sit back and watch our teamwork!
Hmm, this part needs precise detailing,\nwhich calls for...
A small, concentrated flame! Then I heat\njust the part we want to modify to soften\nit, and...
Done! All right, you two!\nIt's your time to shine!
Lemme just cool that down... ZING!
And I will feed it some delicious mana.
This is amazing! They're crafting those\ncomplicated parts like it's nothing!
Aye, I've never seen such teamwork.
Well, not since they beat me\nin the Golden Anvil competition.
(I don't think me granda was wrong...)
(But the lasses aren't wrong either.\nThere's clearly more'n one path.)
(Which means I gotta find me own!)
I was wonderin' if I could maybe...\nwork with ye on this?
I've got much to learn about teamwork\nand cooperation, and I'm hopin' ye\nmight be willin' to teach me.
Right then, Lazry! I'd like you to handle\nwhichever part is made from the heaviest,\nhardest materials.
Aye, that would be the power reactor's\nstonetech engine. ...Hup!
Whooooa! I keep forgetting how\nfreakin' STRONG you rokkans are!
Aye, leave the heavy liftin' to me!
(Once I learn from these lasses, I'll be\nwell on me way to bein' the best!)
